job_description:
Senior Data Scientist

Summary:

Utilize machine learning and AI expertise to develop and deploy models, collaborating closely with clients and teams to solve business problems and improve product capabilities. This opportunity is fully remote and direct placement with one of our healthcare clients.

Responsibilities:
• Design and implement machine learning models.
• Operationalize models for real-time use and manage end-to-end ML/AI projects.
• Employ advanced statistics to gain actionable insights.
• Collaborate with business users and clients to understand needs and integrate solutions.
• Prototype new analytics offerings and advance the AI/ML roadmap.
• Partner with data engineers to build data pipelines and models.
• Advocate for data quality and best practices.
• Implement models, monitor outcomes, and analyze performance.
• Mentor new team members and stay up-to-date on data science trends.

Qualifications:
• MS in a quantitative discipline.
• 4-6 years of experience in data science, machine learning, visualization, and data storytelling.
• Strong attention to detail, data integrity, and data wrangling skills.
• Proficiency in statistical software (R, Python, etc.) and BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.).
• Advanced Python skills and experience with AWS tools (preferred).
• Expertise in machine learning techniques and algorithms.
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
• Leadership, self-direction, and willingness to teach and learn.
• Experience in healthcare (preferred).

Qualifications: 4-6 years of experience in data science, machine learning, visualization, and data storytelling
